snippet: After his primary opponent went to court over possible voting irregularities, Representative Charles B. Rangel urged constituents to wait for the final results before drawing conclusions.
abstract: Rep Charles B Rangel reaches out to his constituents, urging them to wait for final results after his primary opponent, State Senator Adriano Espaillat, goes to court over possible voting irregularities; Rangel's public appearances in recent days make it appear as if he is still in the middle of the primary election campaign.
lead_paragraph: After his primary opponent went to court over possible voting irregularities, Representative Charles B. Rangel urged constituents to wait for the final results before drawing conclusions.

headline.seo: After Disputed Primary Vote, Rangel and Espaillat Still Campaigning
headline.main: After Disputed Primary, Rangel Still Campaigns
headline.print_headline: After Disputed Primary, Rangel Still Campaigns
